folder: Broad Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
123-117 Broad Street, at adjoining and north of the N.E. corner of South Street, also showing 18-17 South Street, north side, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Broad Street.
1922

Gift of E. M. Jenks.

folder: South Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
South Street, north side, east from Broad Street, to Coenties Slip. A general view, is shown of lower Manhattan, as viewed northward from Pier 5, at the foot of Coenties Slip.
1924.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A portion of view 1, showing Nos. 15-17, 18, 19, 20 and 21. No. 15-17 is the 7-story Broad Street Hospital, shown on the left.
April 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

ASSUMING STREET YO BE EAST AND WEST

folder: South Street & Broad Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
South Street, north side, east from Broad Street to Coenties Siip, showing buildings that face the East River. The Broad Street Hospital is at the left at Broad Street and the Seaman's Church Institute at Coenties Slip. The triangular park at the latter point is Jeanette Park. This was named after Jeannette Bennett, sister of James Gordon Bennett Sr., editor of the New York Herald, who financed an expedition to the Artic in 1879 with Lieutenant Commander George W. DeLong in command of the
425 ton vessel "Jeannette."
Beyond is the Brooklyn Bridge.
View 1: November 1927
George H. Balgue
View 2: August 18, 1935
P. L. Sperr

folder: Broad Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
140-124 Broad Street, west side, from South to Front Streets, inclusive, also showing 13-11 South Street, at, adjoining, and west of the N.W. corner of Broad Street. February 23, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Broad Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Broad Street, north from South Street. The first large building seen is the New York Telephone Company. Beyond it is the skeleton of the Stone & Webster Building.
October 2, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing also in the distance the 36-story Maritime Exchange Building nearing completion.
December 20, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
